Detailed Description

The abstract core socket class.

Abstract class only. Must be inherited.

Definition at line 57 of file core_socket.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual int CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::SetAttributes ( socket_t  _socket  )  [protected, pure virtual]

Sets some important attributes on the socket.

Will set SO_LINGER and TCP_NODELAY on TCP sockets.

Parameters:
_socket The socket to modify.
Returns:
CC_ERR_NONE if no error is encountered, otherwise returns 'errno'.

CrissCross::Errors CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::Ban ( unsigned long  _host  ) 

Will add a host to the banned hosts list.

Doing this, when ENABLE_PROTECTION is defined will prevent the banned host from connecting (or, if the instance is a non-streaming socket, ignore data sent by the host).

Parameters:
_host The host to ban (retrieve this with GetRemoteHost()).
Returns:
Currently always returns CC_ERR_NONE.

virtual CrissCross::Errors CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::Close (  )  [virtual]

Close the socket.

Doesn't need to be called before an instance is destructed, because it is automatically called in the destructor.

Returns:
Currently always returns CC_ERR_NONE.

virtual CrissCross::Errors CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::GetError (  )  [virtual]

Get the error value for the socket.

Returns:
The error value for the socket.

u_long CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::GetRemoteHost (  ) 

Fetches the IP address of the remote host.

Returns:
The host represented in old-style sockaddr_in format.

const char* CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::GetRemoteIP (  ) 

Fetches the IP address of the remote host.

Returns:
A pointer to the IP address string in dot notation. Note that the pointer this returns will be reused on the next GetRemoteIP call, so the data pointed at by the return value should be copied into another buffer.

u_long CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::GetLocalHost (  ) 

Fetches the IP address of the remote host.

Returns:
The host represented in old-style sockaddr_in format.

const char* CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::GetLocalIP (  ) 

Fetches the IP address of the remote host.

Returns:
A pointer to the IP address string in dot notation. Note that the pointer this returns will be reused on the next GetRemoteIP call, so the data pointed at by the return value should be copied into another buffer.

socket_t CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::GetSocket (  ) 

Gives access to the socket itself (for extensibility only).

Returns:
CoreSocket::m_sock

bool CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::IsBanned ( unsigned long  _host  )  const

Indicates whether the specified host is banned or not.

Parameters:
_host The host to ban (retrieve this with GetRemoteHost()).
Returns:
True or false, depending on whether the host is banned or not.

socketState CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::State (  )  const

Fetch the state of the socket.

Returns:
The current state of m_sock.
See also:
CrissCross::Network::socketState

virtual CrissCross::Errors CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::Listen ( unsigned short  _port  )  [pure virtual]

Opens the port specified to listen for incoming connections.

Parameters:
_port The port to listen on.
Returns:
If the return value is greater than zero, it is an 'errno' value. If it is less than zero, it is a socketError value.

Implemented in CrissCross::Network::TCPSocket, and CrissCross::Network::UDPSocket.

virtual int CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::Read ( char *  _output,
unsigned int *  _len 
) [virtual]

Reads a block of data with a specified maximum size.

Parameters:
_output A buffer with size _len. Will contain the received data on return.
_len The maximum number of bytes to read. On return, this will contain the size of data received.
Returns:
If the return value is greater than zero, it is an 'errno' value. If it is less than zero, it is a socketError value.

virtual int CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::Read ( std::string &  _output  )  [virtual]

Reads a block of data with a specified maximum size.

Parameters:
_output An std::string in which the data will be stored.
Returns:
If the return value is greater than zero, it is an 'errno' value. If it is less than zero, it is a socketError value.

virtual int CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::Send ( const void *  _data,
size_t  _length 
) [virtual]

Sends a block of data.

Parameters:
_data The data to be sent.
_length The number of bytes of _data to send (must NOT exceed the size of _data).
Returns:
The actual number of bytes sent.

virtual int CrissCross::Network::CoreSocket::Send ( std::string  _data  )  [virtual]

Parameters:
_data The string to be sent.
Returns:
